*Checkout.com's payment gateway determines the charge amount by assessing the value and the currency contained in the charge request.* The value field in a charge request must be a non-zero positive integer â€” no decimals. Depending on the currency of the payment, there are three options for calculating the value amount: <span class="method_hl">Option 1:</span> [**The full value**](doc:calculating-the-value#section-full-value) <span class="method_hl">Option 2:</span> [**The value divided by 1000**](doc:calculating-the-value#section-value-divided-by-1000) <span class="method_hl">Option 3:</span> [**The value divided by 100**](doc:calculating-the-value#section-value-divided-by-100)  
The amount field accepts a minimum of one and a maximum of nine digits; this is true for all currencies. 
--- 
## <span class="method_hl">Option 1:</span> The full value For the following currencies, the value is the same as the full charge amount; for example, `value=100` is equal to 100 Japanese Yen.  
x

Below is an example payment request for 5000 Japanese Yen.  
cURL
rename Â· delete
13
 
1
curl https://sandbox.checkout.com/api2/v2/charges/card
2
    -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
    -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
    -X POST
5
    -d {
6
          "autoCapTime": "24",
7
          "autoCapture": "Y",
8
          "email": "tim.armstrong@checkout.com",
9
          "value": "5000",
10
          "currency": "JPY",
11
          "trackId": "TRK12345",
12
          "cardId": "card_49E69E61-8E35-40E0-AA10-B0B15F198275"
13
        }
Import from Gist
--- ## <span class="method_hl">Option 2:</span> The value divided by 1000 With the below currencies, divide the value by 1000 to work out the value amount; for example, `value=1000` is the same as 1 Bahraini Dinar. 
The last digit must always be a 0. For example, a value of 1310 would be processed whereas 1312 will fail. 
 
x    
Add Row Add Col
BHD 
Bahraini Dinars 
LYD 
Libyan Dinar 
JOD 
Jordanian Dinars 
KWD 
Kuwaiti Dinars 
OMR 
Omani Rials 
TND 
Tunisian Dinar 
The example below shows a payment request for 50 Bahraini Dinars.

3

    -X POST

--- ## <span class="method_hl">Option 3:</span> The value divided by 100 For all other currencies, divide the value by 100 to calculate the charge amount; for example, `value = 100` is equivalent to 1 US Dollar. 
the last two digits must be 00. For example, a value of 500100 would be processed successfully whereas 500095 will not. 
The following example is a payment request for 50.95 US Dollars. 
cURL
